item.title: Natalie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "I have written a wicked book, and feel spotless as the lamb." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "In the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Natalie add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "It is the writer's privilege to help man endure by lifting his heart." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "There are two ways of spreading light: to be The candle or the mirror that reflects it." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Natalie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Natalie add a quote by James A. Michener
item.description: "For this is the journey that men make, to find themselves. If they fail in this, it doesn't matter much what else they find." -- James A. Michener

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I am not given to exaggeration, and when I say a thing I mean it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Maharishi Mahesh Yogi
item.description: "Like the air, God's Grace is available to us. It is permeating every fibre of Being and the Being of the entire universe. When we take our attention to that Being, finer than the finest, then we establish ourselves on the level of God's Grace. Immediately we just enjoy. Life is Bliss!" -- Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Jane Bowles
item.description: "I am a writer and I want to write." -- Jane Bowles

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "When the past is recaptured by the imagination, breath is put back into life." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Dorothy Day
item.description: "I have long since come to believe that people never mean half of what they say, and that it is best to disregard their talk and judge only their actions." -- Dorothy Day

item.title: Natalie add a quote by Kathleen M. Rodgers
item.description: "For some the truth is too painful to hear. For others, itâ€™s a healing balm. This is why I write - to heal." -- Kathleen M. Rodgers
